metadata.synopsis: At camp, Karlach invites the player on a date. The dialogue will teleport them to the date location. If Henk is not available for the dialog, Honk will be instead.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Gortash must have been permadefeated and Karlach has to be in the party and have an avatar romantic partner and move to CTY_Main_A. Then go a long rest. More than one might be needed specially since Orin's abduction has priority over this night.If using the origin debug book then:1. Load CTY_Main_A2. Recruit Karlach as a companion.3. "Karlach" -> "Act 3 Romance" -> "Partner Karlach"3. "Karlach" -> "Act 3 Romance" -> "Unlock romance night"

53.speaker: Karlach
53.text: I need to be alone, all right? I'm very fucking confused right now.
53.context: NodeContext: Hurt. Not angry, but confused.

78.speaker: Karlach
78.text: I've figured it out. Exactly what I want to do with you.

89.speaker: Karlach
89.text: I want to go on a date. A first date. No weapons, no monsters, no mysterious voices... just you and me and dinner.

95.speaker: Karlach
95.context: NodeContext: Ingenue essence, not a demand but almost a plead.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: I'd love to go out with you.

130.speaker: Karlach
130.text: Yes! Amazing. Put on your least bloody tunic and meet me back here. Eee, I'm so excited!
130.context: NodeContext: Huge smile, super happy, does a little dance.

108.speaker: Karlach
108.text: Give me a beat to run ahead - I want to make sure everything's absolutely perfect. See you there!

26.speaker: Karlach
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Player walks into Dancing Lute Tavern and spots Karlach, who's already sitting at one of the tables. It's decorated in a white tablecloth and candles. She beckons you over. Please reach out to Greg for poses/staging/characters/props placaments ref [CHOICES]

194.speaker: Karlach
194.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Player takes a seat oppsite Karlach. They both pick up menus (menu is like a paper, not book type) and read them over, Karlach glancing at the player nervously from time to time.

176.speaker: Karlach
176.context: NodeContext: Responding to the player telling her she looks nice. Warm, pleased.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: I feel you could've made a bit more of an effort.

45.speaker: Karlach
45.text: I refuse to find out you're an arsehole at this late juncture, so I'm going to pretend I didn't hear that.

69.speaker: Karlach
69.text: Hmm. Baldurian seafood stew. No thank you. What do you think you'll have?
69.context: CinematicNodeContext: She smiles, scans the menu again. (menu is like a piece of paper, not book type)

67.speaker: Player
67.text: I actually think the seafood stew sounds nice.

72.speaker: Karlach
72.text: Maybe I shouldn't knock what I haven't tried.
72.context: CinematicNodeContext: After Karlach delivered the line, she beckons the waiter over while still holding menu with left hand. Please reach out to Greg for staging/characters/props placaments ref [CHOICES]NodeContext: REcovering from having said it sounds nasty earlier

173.speaker: Tender Henk
173.context: CinematicNodeContext: A bored-looking half-orc drags himself over and grunts at the players (walk few step to the player then talk) Please reach out to Greg for staging/characters/props placaments ref [CHOICES]NodeContext: A grunt meaning 'go ahead and order'.

79.speaker: Tender Honk
79.context: CinematicNodeContext: A bored-looking half-orc drags himself over and grunts at the players (walk few step to the player then talk) Please reach out to Greg for staging/characters/props placaments ref [CHOICES]

188.speaker: Karlach
188.text: We'll both have the seafood stew, please. And two glasses of...
188.context: NodeContext: She looks to the player expectantly, waiting for their drink order.

215.speaker: Tender Henk
215.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] The waiter takes the menus and ambles away.NodeContext: Takign the order with disdain

56.speaker: Tender Honk
56.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] The waiter takes the menus and ambles away.NodeContext: Takign the order with disdain

105.speaker: Karlach
105.text: So! You're an adventurer, right? How's that going?

22.speaker: Player
22.text: You've been by my side for a lot of it, you know.

217.speaker: Karlach
217.text: I know, but this is our first date, remember? Tonight, you're a mystery to me.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: More difficult than expected. The baddies around here are very bad.

21.speaker: Karlach
21.text: Eh. Bad-ish. Not trying to one-up the local villains, of course, but man, have I seen some shit.

198.speaker: Karlach
198.text: But hang on, this isn't first date talk. Tonight, I'm a mystery to you, and you're a mystery to me.

163.speaker: Player
163.text: I'm not sure I can pretend I don't already love you.

170.speaker: Karlach
170.text: It's all I can do to keep my hands to myself, anyway. We're terrible at this.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: That's true. We ought to behave like we've only just met.

229.speaker: Karlach
229.text: Exactly. Anything you'd like to know about your enigmatic new paramour?

239.speaker: Karlach
239.text: Never thought I'd be the type to fall for a fatale like you, but there's a sweetness to you, just beneath the surface. It's irresistible.

4.speaker: Karlach
4.text: In your case, it's practically a vital organ. Though the veil seems to lift that little bit every day, and I just see... you.
4.context: NodeContext: Starts with a laugh; by the end, a look of absolutely love.

20.speaker: Karlach
20.text: Gods, I'm terrible at this. Trying to have a first date, but I feel like I've known you all my life.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Want to get out of here?

133.speaker: Karlach
133.text: No! Yes. No - we came to have a nice date, and that's what we're going to do. Go on: date me. I dare you.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: You're right. So... erm... where did you grow up?

49.speaker: Karlach
49.text: Right here in Baldur's Gate, more or less. My folks are long gone now, but they raised me in the Outer City. Dad was a porter in town, mum did laundry. Still think of her when I smell clean sheets.

126.speaker: Karlach
126.text: We were poorer than dirt, but my gods we had fun. What about you?

82.speaker: Player
82.text: It's very faint... but I think that a foster family looked after me before I ended up in the Temple of Bhaal.

84.speaker: Karlach
84.text: Wonder if they're still out there somewhere. No chance they could've forgotten someone like you.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: My past is a little like yours. No wonder we get along.

63.speaker: Karlach
63.text: Cut from the same cloth, some might say.

152.speaker: Player
152.text: Honestly, I don't like to talk about my past. I'm far more interested in our future.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: I'm from Baldur's Gate, too. I wonder if we ever crossed paths.

225.speaker: Karlach
225.text: Might've, if you spent any time in the Outer City. We didn't exactly hide ourselves under a bushel.

175.speaker: Player
175.text: I grew up in a crèche, like most gith. Not much fun to be had, but plenty of discipline.

186.speaker: Karlach
186.text: It's one of the things I love about you - your ability to see things through.

158.speaker: Player
158.text: I'm from another realm entirely. It would be difficult to explain.

154.speaker: Karlach
154.text: You don't have to explain, if you don't want to. But whatever time I have left, I'd like to spend getting to know you, exactly as you are.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: I grew up in the Underdark - not for the faint of heart.

200.speaker: Karlach
200.text: That explains your grit. And your strength. And so many other things I love about you.

145.speaker: Player
145.text: No problem. So, what's something you've never told anyone before?

147.speaker: Player
147.text: All right, try this on for size: what's your biggest fear?

102.speaker: Player
102.text: Speak for yourself! I'm being very good indeed.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: So, where did you grow up?

9.speaker: Karlach
9.text: Oh that's easy. During year two of my fabulous adventure in celibacy in Avernus, I once got so, erm, pent up, I burnt down my field tent.

110.speaker: Karlach
110.text: Blamed it on an imp and never told a soul the truth. Beat that.

189.speaker: Player
189.text: I often faint at the sight of blood.

129.speaker: Karlach
129.text: Yeah, I'm very sure. I'd ask for a real secret, but I suppose besides the whole child of Bhaal thing, you've always been an open book.

31.speaker: Karlach
31.text: We'll have to make some new secrets between us, then.

214.speaker: Player
214.text: Most of my secrets are lost to the ether. It's not the most exciting thing... but I can't swim.

33.speaker: Karlach
33.text: Aw. Well, if you ever want to learn, I'd love to take you to a little pond I know outside the city. Shallow, safe, and I'd be there to help you float.
33.context: NodeContext: Re: teaching SH how to swim

213.speaker: Player
213.text: I once claimed to have read all six volumes of 'Lichen and Its Curative Properties' to impress a comely botanist. Alas, a falsehood.

219.speaker: Karlach
219.text: You mean you haven't read all six volumes?! Gale Dekarios, I'll never look at you the same.

159.speaker: Player
159.text: I replaced a cousin's sword with a toy blade. A beholder devoured her - pretty funny, all in all.

36.speaker: Karlach
36.text: You are terrifying. I love it so much.
36.context: NodeContext: Stars in her eyes. Talking to Lae'zel

51.speaker: Player
51.text: I stole some of my father's cigars and blamed a servant. Got my arse whipped for it, too.

221.speaker: Karlach
221.text: Hard to imagine you as a naughty little boy. Who knew he'd grow up to be the very paragon of right-doing?

135.speaker: Player
135.text: I still dream of my old master sometimes. I don't know if I'll ever be rid of him.

80.speaker: Karlach
80.text: I understand. The people who hurt us have an annoying habit of lingering, one way or another. I'm sorry for what he did to you.

210.speaker: Karlach
210.text: You deserve better. You deserve the best. I wish I could give it to you for the rest of your life, but I swear it for the rest of mine.

180.speaker: Player
180.text: It'll have to wait - I think our food is coming.

127.speaker: Karlach
127.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] The waiter approaches and roughly drops two plates of food and two cups in front of Karlach and player. The food is something other than the choice made by the player. The two cups are two generic cups, can be any liquid inside.(same cine as N348).InternalNodeContext: (same cine as N348).

181.speaker: Karlach
181.text: Good question. And easy enough, in my case. I'm afraid of dying with regrets. Of living small and giving up the ghost before I've done what I came here to do.

111.speaker: Karlach
111.text: That means going after the things I love. Including you.

88.speaker: Karlach
88.text: I'm sure. You've probably killed scarier things blind and bleeding.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: I fear death. They say the gods will claim us in the afterlife, but there's no guarantee.

104.speaker: Karlach
104.text: No. Particularly not for sinners like us. But if push comes to shove, I'll meet you in the City of Judgement. We'll paint it red.

224.speaker: Player
224.text: I'm afraid of not truly belonging anywhere.

100.speaker: Karlach
100.text: You belong here. With me. I know I'm not a forever kind of investment, but right here, right now, you are it. You are everything.

165.speaker: Player
165.text: I'm afraid I'm doomed to repeat past mistakes, no matter how I try to avoid them.

148.speaker: Karlach
148.text: I know what you mean. Changing is hard. Every time I think I've figured it out, boom, there I am again, behaving like some version of me that never learned a damn thing.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Irrelevance. To leave no wound on my enemies, to stake no claims for my people.

70.speaker: Karlach
70.text: Impossible. You leave your stamp everywhere you go. Just look at me - absolutely besotted.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: My queen's rejection. To be denied my true worth, after all I've given her.

248.speaker: Karlach
248.text: I get it. I can't speak for Vlaakith, but I'll always know who you are. The bravest, fiercest, most gorgeous woman in all the Realms.

203.speaker: Player
203.text: To look within and find I've become the devil I appear to be.

227.speaker: Karlach
227.text: That could never happen. You're the best person I've ever met. Soul and body.
227.context: NodeContext: Very earnest and insistent. She won't hear of Wyll speaking ill of himself after everything he sacrificed for her

245.speaker: Player
245.text: For me, it's control. I won't be under someone's thumb ever again.

179.speaker: Karlach
179.text: Fucking preach. Any rat bastard comes after you again, and I'll destroy them. I promise.

43.speaker: Karlach
43.text: You might be your own greatest fear, but you're your own greatest strength, too. I see that every time I look at you.

174.speaker: Karlach
174.text: Oh - hey! Here comes our food.
174.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] The waiter approaches and roughly drops two plates of food and two cups in front of Karlach and player. The food is something other than the choice made by the player. The two cups are two generic cups, can be any liquid inside.

101.speaker: Karlach
101.text: Hey, uh, Henk, I think we ordered the -
101.context: NodeContext: Karlach looks up at Henk, noticing the food is wrong.

162.speaker: Tender Henk
162.context: CinematicNodeContext: Henk turns back and walks away from the table. Please reach out to Greg for staging/characters/props placaments ref [CHOICES]NodeContext: Vague menace, a 'do not ask questions' spoken when Karlach tries to tell Henk he gave her the wrong food.

19.speaker: Karlach
19.text: Hey, uh, Honk, I think we ordered the -

120.speaker: Tender Honk
120.context: CinematicNodeContext: Henk turns back and walks away from the table. Please reach out to Greg for staging/characters/props placaments ref [CHOICES]

86.speaker: Karlach
86.text: Worst guy I ever met. Anyway, how about a toast? Oh - shit!
86.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach shrugs, amused at Henk's horribleness. She reaches for the drink to hold it aloft and propose a toast, but she fumbles it and knocks the glass over, then she back to standard sitting pose. Please reach out to Greg for staging/characters/props placaments ref [CHOICES]NodeContext: Low, laughing, affectionate voice on 'worst guy'. She drop the drink at " Oh-shit!"

166.speaker: Player
166.text: We can use my glass. To us.

149.speaker: Karlach
149.text: May we live every day like it's our last.
149.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Player raises their glass in toast, drinks from their cup, and is about to pass it to Karlach to drink, but she's roughly leaned over the table  to grab the player and kiss them. She sits back down, jostling the table again.InternalNodeContext: Same as N238

92.speaker: Karlach
92.text: 'Cause you never know when your last will come.
92.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Camera zoom out implying they're eating and drinking. When it comes back to them, the plates/ cups are gone and the lights are dimmer, implying the passage of time.InternalNodeContext: Same as N239

25.speaker: Karlach
25.text: That was great. The food and the company.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: What do you want to do now?

169.speaker: Karlach
169.text: You know what I want to do.
169.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] She reaches across the table o the player, takes their hands in hers.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: Lovely having a normal evening amid the chaos.

57.speaker: Karlach
57.text: Whatever do you mean? We're just two normal people living normal lives very, very normally.
57.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] She reaches across the table o the player, takes their hands in hers.

195.speaker: Karlach
195.text: I know I can't stay forever. Here. With you. In fact, I feel like... like I don't have long left at all.

98.speaker: Karlach
98.text: We've been through so much, and the worst is yet to come. I have every reason to feel terrified... hopeless... like giving up.

241.speaker: Karlach
241.text: But to be here, with you, in the city I love, in this world that I love so much... It's all I could really ask for.

77.speaker: Karlach
77.text: You hear me? You're all I could ever ask for. I love you. And I know that whatever else this city will throw at us, we can handle it.

231.speaker: Karlach
231.text: Come on. There's something I want to show you upstairs.
231.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] She releases the player's hand.

40.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black that opens on the player and Karlach in one of the rooms in the inn. This will be a scene of non-sexual intimacy.

The player and Karlach will get into bed, lying on their backs, chatting to each other (no sound) and laughing while holding hands. Eventually they'll both turn on their sides to be facing one another. Karlach reaches up to hold the player's face and scooches forward to kiss their forehad and cheek, then a chaste but sweet peck on the lips.Player and Karlach fall asleep wrapped in each other's arms.

218.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black that opens on the player and Karlach in one of the rooms in the inn. This will be a scene of non-sexual intimacy.

The player and Karlach will get into bed, lying on their backs, chatting to each other (no sound) and laughing while holding hands. Eventually they'll both turn on their sides to be facing one another. Karlach reaches up to hold the player's face and scooches forward to kiss their forehad and cheek, then a chaste but sweet peck on the lips.Player and Karlach fall asleep wrapped in each other's arms.

8.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black that opens on the player and Karlach in one of the rooms in the inn. This will be a scene of sexual intimacy. (The following is open to interpretation/ details can and should evolve to suit cinematic + actor needs)

Karlach sits on the bed in the room and the player approaches, positioning themself between her legs and kissing her deeply. Karlach stands up, lifts up the player off their feet and rolls them onto the bed, Karlach on top. She pauses, looking deep into the player's eyes. A look of consertnation passes briefly over her face, then the mood breaks. She smiles. (She is thinking about her mortality, about how much she loves the player, about the fragility of life). She bends down and kisses the player, then rolls to lay beside them, touching them intimately with one hand while she kisses them. Things escalate from there.

123.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black that opens on the player and Karlach in one of the rooms in the inn. This will be a scene of sexual intimacy. (The following is open to interpretation/ details can and should evolve to suit cinematic + actor needs)

Karlach sits on the bed in the room and the player approaches, positioning themself between her legs and kissing her deeply. Karlach stands up, lifts up the player off their feet and rolls them onto the bed, Karlach on top. She pauses, looking deep into the player's eyes. A look of consertnation passes briefly over her face, then the mood breaks. She smiles. (She is thinking about her mortality, about how much she loves the player, about the fragility of life). She bends down and kisses the player, then rolls to lay beside them, touching them intimately with one hand while she kisses them. Things escalate from there.

220.speaker: Karlach
220.text: I rented us a room for the whole night. Just the two of us - alone, finally.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: I'll happily head upstairs with you, but I want to make sure I'm clear about not wanting to sleep together.

5.speaker: Karlach
5.text: I just want to be with you, however you like. You're in control.

118.speaker: Player
118.text: I think I should say goodnight here, Karlach.

46.speaker: Karlach
46.text: Oh. All right. Well - good night. I had a great time with you. Really great. I... hope you did too.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: Let's get out of here. I need you.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: I was half-hoping some bandits would burst in and give us something to do.

114.speaker: Karlach
114.text: Looks like I need to find a more active way to entertain you.
114.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] She reaches across the table o the player, takes their hands in hers.

185.speaker: Karlach
185.text: Hey! Oaves have feelings too. I don't know why I'm nervous. Looks like we'll have to raise your glass.

182.speaker: Karlach
182.text: Sorry, sorry. Hope they don't stain. Care to raise your glass to that?
182.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Player raises their glass in toast, drinks from their cup, and is about to pass it to Karlach to drink, but she's roughly leaned over the table  to grab the player and kiss them. She sits back down, jostling the table again.InternalNodeContext: Same as N52

156.speaker: Karlach
156.text: Here's to living every day like it's our last.
156.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Camera zoom out implying they're eating and drinking. When it comes back to them, the plates/ cups are gone and the lights are dimmer, implying the passage of time.InternalNodeContext: Same as N53

1.speaker: Player
1.text: It'll have to wait - I think our food is coming.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: You're right. What should we do?

90.speaker: Karlach
90.text: Hmm. Ask me a question, maybe. A getting-to-know-you type question.

107.speaker: Karlach
107.text: You know, it does. There's always a bit of a veil about you - I guess it's the magic, but there's something else, too. Something I want to discover first-hand.

113.speaker: Karlach
113.text: Everything about you is new to me, honey. You're the first gith I've met, sure, but you're also singular in the world for so many other reasons.

34.speaker: Karlach
34.text: I'm not sure. I feel like I saw the heart of you from the very beginning. And I've had a piece of you with me ever since.

62.speaker: Karlach
62.text: Hmm. Partially. On the one hand, you're dangerous temptation itself. On the other, there's something very frank about you. Something familiar.

216.speaker: Karlach
216.text: It does. There's so much about you I don't know, but I'm hungry for every part of it.

207.speaker: Player
207.text: Like you, I wear my heart on my sleeve. Can't we skip the pleasantries?

128.speaker: Karlach
128.text: You're right. Small talk is for small people. And we loom large. But still - first date. So let's make with the first-dating.

134.speaker: Player
134.text: Pretty straightforward: kill the monsters, save the townsfolk, bish bash bosh.

76.speaker: Karlach
76.text: Kill the monsters, save the townsfolk, sweep the local hellbeast off her feet?

177.speaker: Player
177.text: That was an unexpected and very welcome twist.

155.speaker: Player
155.text: I don't think I could knock you off your feet if I tried.

131.speaker: Karlach
131.text: True! Then let's say you... brought me to my knees.

196.speaker: Player
196.text: You're not a hell-beast. You're a hell-champion.

68.speaker: Karlach
68.text: You speak true! And now I'll claim my reward for my labours escaping the evil archdevil: you.

85.speaker: Karlach
85.text: Gods, we're terrible at this. This was supposed to be a first date, but it's all I can do to keep my hands to myself.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: The grilled rothé ribs sound good.

75.speaker: Karlach
75.text: Just what I had in mind.
75.context: CinematicNodeContext: After Karlach delivered the line, she beckons the waiter over while still holding menu with left hand. Please reach out to Greg for staging/characters/props placaments ref [CHOICES]

228.speaker: Karlach
228.text: Two of the rothé ribs, please. And two glasses of...
228.context: NodeContext: She looks to the player expectantly, waiting for their drink order.

236.speaker: Karlach
236.context: CinematicNodeContext: After Karlach delivered the line, she beckons the waiter over while still holding menu with left hand. Please reach out to Greg for staging/characters/props placaments ref [CHOICES]

48.speaker: Karlach
48.text: Two pumpkin stews, my good man. And two glasses of...
48.context: NodeContext: She looks to the player expectantly, waiting for their drink order.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: A simple bowl of gruel for me.

61.speaker: Karlach
61.text: Why's that even on the menu? Then again, if it's good enough for you, I suppose it's good enough for me too.
61.context: CinematicNodeContext: After Karlach delivered the line, she beckons the waiter over while still holding menu with left hand. Please reach out to Greg for staging/characters/props placaments ref [CHOICES]

17.speaker: Karlach
17.text: A duo of your finest gruel, please. And two glasses of...
17.context: NodeContext: She looks to the player expectantly, waiting for their drink order.

132.speaker: Player
132.text: I just need a little while to prepare.

141.speaker: Karlach
141.text: Don't keep me waiting too long!

206.speaker: Player
206.text: What did you have in mind?

96.speaker: Karlach
96.text: There's a little spot I know in town. Out of the way, but the view of the city is incredible.

205.speaker: Player
205.text: I just think we ought to slow things down.

201.speaker: Karlach
201.text: I'm sorry, but I don't have time for that. Literally. I care about you, but I'm not going to chase after you.

243.speaker: Player
243.text: I like you, but I'm not sure I'm ready to take things to the next level.

211.speaker: Karlach
211.text: So you can lap me up like dessert, but a meal together is taking things too far?

137.speaker: Karlach
137.text: I get it. I didn't mean to overstep. There's just so much I want to do in the little time I have left.

50.speaker: Karlach
50.text: If this is it for us, I accept that. But I'd like to find someone who's keen to have a nice meal with me while I still can.

28.speaker: Karlach
28.text: I'm sure you can understand that.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I'm just not interested in you.

242.speaker: Karlach
242.text: After... after everything? Everything you said? Everything I said? You...

41.speaker: Karlach
41.text: I need a minute. I need a lot of minutes. Please.

204.speaker: Player
204.text: Cliff diving? Naked horse riding? Duelling a troll?

74.speaker: Karlach
74.text: Even crazier than that, if you can believe it.

191.speaker: Player
191.text: I'm not sure my orifices are ready.

136.speaker: Karlach
136.text: A little inn in the city - the Singing Lute, it's called. If it's anything like it used to be, we'll have the place all to ourselves.

222.speaker: Karlach
222.text: I'm buying, all right? Let it be said, let it be written, let it be done.

226.speaker: Karlach
226.text: Hup hup, eh? I haven't got forever.
